answers.answer: Im not teak, but what he will tell you is no that signs are never and indication of your status.

it could be fungal infection...candidiasis (subacute cutaneous) can present with mouth lesions, (chronic) will present with dry mouth, and in moist areas such as armpits inflamation of the skin (maceration) can lead to candidiasis infection. Unfortunately, cand usually shows up in immunocompromised pts., which doesn't have to be HIV it could be adult onset diabetes, the result of chemo, catheters, or a transplant.

question: Hopefully.Has it ever been proven that sore armpits, dry mouth, and mouth sores are a sign of HIV infection? Or early stages of HIV?
title: TEAK this is my last question to you...
